1.courseDetails: Welcome to the exciting world of Visual Storytelling! In this course, students in the 3rd semester of the Bachelor of Design program will dive into the fundamentals and intricacies of sketching for design, bridging the gap between imagination and reality. Through hands-on exercises, creative projects, and expert guidance, you will develop essential sketching techniques and gain the ability to convey your design ideas visually with confidence and precision.

6.keywords: high quality, premium, cork material, lifestyle products,

7.courseName: Technical Drawing for Fashion (Flats and specs)
7.courseDetails: This course talks about the importance of understanding and creating flat sketches for apparel production units. Flat sketches play a vital role in understanding the garment construction.
7.keywords: Technical Drawings, Flat Drawings, Spec Sheet, 2D Drawing, Garment Construction

8.courseDetails: 3D Visualization of Spaces & Introduction to Virtual Reality

10.courseDetails: It teaches fundamental sketching techniques to effectively communicate design ideas through  drawings. Participants learn line work, shading, perspective, and composition, enabling them to  bring their concepts to life. This course emphasizes sketching as a tool for ideation, iteration, and  collaboration in product development. By enhancing their visual communication abilities,  participants can create compelling designs and effectively convey their vision to stakeholders.
10.keywords: sketching, Product sketching, rendering, marker rendering

12.courseDetails: Human factors (Ergonomics) are the study of human abilities and characteristics which affect the  design of equipment, systems, and jobs. Its study and appropriate applications aim at improving  the working conditions, work methods, efficiency, performance, occupational safety, health, and  productivity of the system.
12.keywords: Ergonomics, anthropometry, human factors, measurements, ergonomic study, ergonomic feasibility

13.courseDetails: The objectives of this course are to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of  fundamental research principles, including the classification and structure of Design research. It aims  to cultivate students' reading and analytical skills in research, while also focusing on the  development and formulation of effective writing skills.
13.keywords: research, design, ethnography, interviews, user research

14.courseName: Elective I - Graphic Design and Layout
14.courseDetails: This course provides an introduction to the fundamental principles of graphic design and explores its  application in the context of product design. Students will develop a comprehensive understanding  of the key elements of graphic design, including color theory, typography, composition, and visual  hierarchy. They will learn how to effectively apply these principles to create visually appealing and  impactful designs for products. The course also focuses on the principles of layouting, teaching  students how to arrange visual elements in a harmonious and aesthetically pleasing manner.  Through hands-on projects and practical exercises, students will gain valuable skills in creating  compelling graphic designs that enhance the overall user experience and communicate effectively in  the field of product design.
14.keywords: Graphic design, layout, illustration, digital sketch, rendering

15.courseDetails: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to the fundamental principles of graphic design  and its versatile applications. Students will explore key elements such as typography, color theory,  composition, and imagery, developing a solid understanding of how these components contribute to  effective visual communication. Emphasis is placed on visual identity building, where students learn  to strategically utilize design elements to establish cohesive and recognizable brand identities.  Through practical exercises and real-world case studies, students gain hands-on experience in  creating visual identity systems, including logo design, typography selection, color palette creation,  and brand guidelines. By the end of the course, students will have a strong foundation in graphic  design principles and the ability to apply their knowledge to develop visually compelling designs and  establish impactful visual identities. This course equips students with essential skills for success in  the dynamic field of graphic design and visual identity building.
15.keywords: Visual identity, storyboarding, branding, brand identity

19.courseDetails: Three-dimensional visual representation is becoming the standard norm in the  industry and this course introduces the students to Fusion 360 as a tool for 3D  modelling. Modelling styles like sculpting as well as solid modelling makeup the major  part of the modelling forefront which gives the students various directions to tackle a  modelling task. Through this course the students will learn to take their twodimensional sketches and ideas to 3D easily. A brief introduction into creating models  for 3D printing will also be included.
19.keywords: operating Fusion 360, creating 3D models and  basic 3D visualization.

20.courseDetails: The course was primarily aims to introduce various manufacturing processes used in automotive industries and landscape of  micro mobility to third year design student. The outcome of this course will connect with the broader creative learning goal like  elements of manufacturing techniques used in automotive industries, Automotive design, the principle of shared mobility  design, and understanding the relevance of booming scenario of micro mobility. The students will present their concepts in  renders and as a 3D Models keeping micro mobility as the center theme.
20.keywords: automotive industries and landscape of  micro mobility

21.courseDetails: This course introduce students to the needs, perceptions and expectations of ‘the user’ of  products, services and interfaces. It will develop an introductory awareness of user  behaviour, ethnographic studies, usability testing and the evaluation of user requirements. Through group discussions and exercises, students will gain an understanding into how user  centered design process will help build comfort, convenience and ease of use without  compromising the performance of designed products.

22.courseDetails: This course provides an introduction to the fundamental principles of graphic design and explores its  application in the context of product design. Students will develop a comprehensive understanding  of the key elements of graphic design, including color theory, typography, composition, and visual  hierarchy.
22.keywords: fundamental principles of graphic design and explores its  application in the context of product design.

23.courseDetails: Digital Illustration for Product Design is a comprehensive course designed to equip students with the  necessary skills and techniques to create visually compelling and impactful illustrations using digital  tools

24.courseDetails: The course on Extended Realities(XR) aims to teach product design students the fundamentals of Augmented  Reality (AR), Virtual Reality(VR) and the Metaverse, and how to build an AR experience using Meta's Spark AR & a  basic understanding of creating VR experience.
24.keywords: Conceptualization, brainstorming and articulation Shaping thoughts into concepts, and presentation.

25.courseDetails: The course focuses on developing a deep understanding of human needs, empathy, and collaboration while utilizing design thinking principles to address real-world problems. Through this  course, students will gain practical experience in engaging with communities and delivering  impactful design interventions to enhance the lives of these communities.
25.keywords: Theoretical lectures, practical exercises, collaborative projects, fieldwork, and  design critiques.

27.courseDetails: This course exposes the students to the digital tools for fashion illustration. The student will learn to implement tools and techniques of digital media to create enhanced renders / graphics and fashion illustrations.

28.courseDetails: The course is designed to have the theoretical study of apparel manufacturing technology, which is the base of the apparel industry business. Students are introduced to the apparel industry’s overview and basic organizational structure and process. The course emphasizes product development, pre-production activities, lay, and marker planning. And explains the concepts of production planning & control of the cutting, sewing, and packing department. It has also included the manufacturing systems, operation breakdown and development of production flow chart.

30.courseDetails: Draping is the art of using fabric to create designs directly on a human body form. Draping is considered the more creative method of pattern making and it is an essential skill for fashion designers. Draping helps to develop skills from the most basic to more advanced techniques of garment making. Draping allows the designer to get feel of the fabric as the fabric is draped on the body form. Draping enables the designer to make intelligent choices when considering the suitability of a particular fabric to its design and silhouette.
30.keywords: measurements, shape, and form of the dress form of different standard sizes.

31.courseDetails: The course is designed to inculcate the skills of making patterns and stitching with custom made clothing techniques for Womenswear and Menswear. Pattern Making introduces to a student all the drafting rules to create a stylised sewing pattern. Understanding to make different slopers and how they are used and essential pattern making. It exposes students to the different tools needed for pattern making and what they are and how they are used.

32.courseDetails: This introductory course on textiles specifically deals with space design. Textiles being an integral part of various elements in space design, this course will enable students to identify and utilize appropriate textiles according to the context.
32.keywords: Recognize the various traditional textiles of India.

33.courseDetails: Develop concept and design collection based on client brief.  Understanding of the Design Process as applicable to Fashion Industry – HAUTE COUTURE AND THE WORKING STYPE OF COUTURIERS, FUNCTIONING OF BOUTIQUES
33.keywords: HAUTE COUTURE AND THE WORKING STYPE OF COUTURIERS

35.courseDetails: Orient the student to create the three‐dimensional objects in space with special emphasis on presentation and visualization of interiors using rendering technique using 3D‐Max
35.keywords: 3D‐SketchUP, Advanced tools for drawing on 3D geometry

36.courseDetails: knowledge on the various materials while highlighting the current trends and innovations in the usage of interior design materials.

37.courseDetails: Understanding the socio‐cultural and historical aspects that influence the design of accessories and products based on their lifestyle.
37.keywords: design of accessories and products based on their lifestyle

38.courseDetails: To develop creative conceptual visualization, hand skill building, and the process of design. The emphasis shallbe on Concepts, layouts, elevations and sections as a design process.
38.keywords: Introduction to building codes, Way finding, Signage and graphics

39.courseDetails: Foundation and capability to represent the concepts three dimensionally.

40.courseDetails: Introduction to textiles; History of textiles in context to use in Interior spaces; Importance & role  of textiles inspace design.
40.keywords: Woven fabrics: Types of weaves, study of weaves.

41.courseDetails: To achieve overall health of body and mind and to overcome stress

42.courseDetails: Understanding of Art/craft forms as design elements and its relevant application in the modern society. Modernization of old craft technology for better forms for interior use.
42.keywords: revitalization of Art/craft form in interior spaces.

Through group discussions and exercises, students will gain an understanding into how user centered design process will help build comfort, convenience, and ease of use without compromising the performance of designed products.

44.courseDetails: This course will help students to gain research and application knowledge to design a User Interface and User Experience based graphical design to compete in the Digital age.

45.courseDetails: The course is an introduction to motion graphics, covering the fundamentals of animation, design, and typography. Students will learn how to create and animate text, shapes, and images, and how to use these elements to create dynamic and engaging motion graphics.
45.keywords: Understanding the principles of animation, Designing effective typography

46.courseDetails: In modern times, the role of design in society and environment has become crucial towards complex wicked problems. The problem space covers a large area from social issues and human rights to environmental causes, conservation and preservation.
46.keywords: Adobe Photoshop  · Adobe Illustrator  · Adobe Premiere

48.courseDetails: The aim of this course is to improve physical wellness through asana and pranayama practice. One Also gets a perspective of the classical form of yoga using meditation and other tools in yoga. Yoga Sutras which was originally presented by Maharishi Patanjali for a self-discovery process prepares us for facing the challenges of life and to experience bliss and peace of mind.

49.courseDetails: Design Research is essential to fashion design. This course will an introduction to Design research in context with Fashion design.

50.courseDetails: To understand multiple software mediums for transferring students’ concepts to tangible outcomes.

51.courseDetails: Draping is the art of using fabric to create designs directly on a human body form. Draping helps to develop skills from the most basic to more advanced techniques of garment making. Draping allows the designer to get feel of the fabric as the fabric is draped on the body form. Draping enables the designer to make intelligent choices when considering the suitability of a particular fabric to its design and silhouette.

52.courseDetails: Fashion Illustration I introduces the students to the basic croquis, for female / male and kids, to help them develop an understanding of basic proportions of the body, in various actions and stills. The student will be able to understand the use of lines and curves to depicts various expressions of body and to depict the fabric in fashion illustrations.

53.courseDetails: Fashion Styling and Photography is a subject that will allow the students to understand how clothing can be presented in advertising, through campaigns, catalogues, and fashion magazines. Working closely with designs and designers and fashion houses to ensure the portrayal of the desired look and concept. Develop an understanding of lighting, props and location for any photoshoot.

54.courseDetails: This course talks about a historic narrative of the concepts of fashion starting from the 16th century Europe, gradually progressing towards the emergence of Haute Couture and the Couturiers, Industrialization and the emergent R-T-W industry. To make students understand the historic context of fashion and the developments in the various periods in history. ▪ To appreciate the landmarks in Fashion History and the contribution of various iconic designers.
54.keywords: Fashion History, Costumes, Menswear, Womens wear, Clothing

55.courseDetails: Develop an understanding of various processes involved in the conversion of fiber to fabric. Contextualize the performance characteristics of different fibers and fabrics for suitable end use.

57.courseDetails: This course will be an introduction to Pret design which is known as READY-TO-WEAR design. Initiate the students to what is pret-a-porter. Understand customer identification & research. Ready-to-wear brand study – market study. Explore ideas in design, develop sense in skill and technique. Understand the suitability, trends, market demand in production of a fashion range/product. Understanding of the Design Process as applicable in Ready to Wear clothing line.

58.courseDetails: The Social Internship course aims to provide first-year design school students with an opportunity to apply their skills and knowledge in a real-world social context. This course combines practical experience with critical reflection to help students understand the role of design in understanding and addressing social issues and creating positive change. Students will engage in an internship placement with a social organization, where they will work on social projects that have a direct impact on communities and individuals.

72.courseName: Elective II – Indigenous Art, Design & Culture
72.courseDetails: This course provides an in-depth exploration of Indigenous art, design, and culture within the Indian  context. Students will examine the rich cultural heritage of Indigenous communities and learn about  their artistic traditions, design principles, and cultural significance. Through a combination of  theoretical study, case studies, and practical assignments, students will develop a deeper  understanding of Indigenous art and design practices, fostering cultural sensitivity and appreciation.
72.keywords: indigenous art, design and culture of India.

74.courseDetails: The Basics of Form Study course aims to provide students with a strong foundation in understanding  and analyzing the forms and shapes of various design objects. Through a combination of theory,  practical exercises, and projects, students will develop essential skills in form analysis,  interpretation, and ideation. They will learn to appreciate the relationship between form and  function and gain a deeper understanding of how to create visually appealing and functional designs.

75.courseDetails: This course offers an in-depth exploration of the history of industrial design, focusing on both global  and Indian contexts. It aims to provide students with a comprehensive understanding of the  evolution of industrial design and its impact on society, culture, and technology. Through the study  of key historical periods, influential designers, significant movements, and groundbreaking  innovations, students will gain insights into the development and transformation of industrial design  practices.

77.courseDetails: This course makes students to understand what communication is, its functions, and the structure of communication.

80.courseDetails: This course intends to introduce the intensive knowledge of technical and aesthetical aspects of Layout Design. Professional capacity-building is a major focus area of this course; Students will learn the advance skill for developing the effective visual communication design.

81.courseDetails: This course intends to introduce the intensive knowledge of technical and aesthetical aspects of Ilustration. Professional capacity-building is a major focus area of this course; Students will learn the advance skill for developing the effective illustrations.

84.courseDetails: This course examines the mass media as complex social institutions that exercise multiple roles in society—none more crucial than the circulation and validation of social discourses. 189.courseDetails: Ability to work with color schemes and palettes used in RTW fashion segment. Understanding of silhouette design, pattern making related to RTW garment categories. Ability to create a fully sewed, constructed, and finished garment as per the industry standards. Establish a work frame of research, research analysis, Design process, design derivation and execution of design as per fashion industry design process, development, consumer & market, price point and design aesthetics.

191.courseDetails: Gain a solid understanding of AI's basics and historical evolution in industrial design. Experience hands-on use of AI tools for research, ideation, documentation, and processing. Utilize AI technologies for enhanced user research, employing natural language processing and sentiment analysis to inform design decisions. Implement generative design principles to empower creativity with AI-driven techniques for innovative and optimized concepts.

195.courseDetails: Students will come up with a problem statement, brief area from their own interest, skills, experience.
195.keywords: open brief, self exploration, dp3, project,

196.courseDetails: This course introduces the fundamentals of color psychology, exploring principles of color perception, cultural influences, and historical perspectives. It delves into the psychological effects of colors, examining their impact on emotions, behaviors, and cognition, as well as associations that evoke specific moods. Students learn to apply color theory in fields like marketing, design, art therapy, interior design, and branding, focusing on combinations, contrasts, and harmonies to achieve objectives. Cultural and contextual considerations are addressed through case studies, analyzing how societal norms and individual differences shape color perception and interpretation across diverse contexts.
196.keywords: Color Psychology, Color Perception, Psychological Effects of Color, Color Symbolism Color Theory Color and Emotions Cultural Influences on Color Color Combinations and Harmony

197.courseDetails: To experience and learn the degree of efforts and stages concerned with the development of the entire collection of garments. To apply the workflow involved in the design process starting from conceptualization to execution of garments.
197.keywords: Research & Analysis Brand Conceptualization Design Development Material & Technical Aspects Marketing & Finalization

200.courseDetails: To enable the student to feel and sculpt the fabric into a 3-dimensional form. To inculcate the sense of proportion and placement of style lines and obtain harmony and balance between the fabric and design.
200.keywords: Fabric Manipulation 3D Form Sculpting Proportion & Balance Style Line Placement Design Harmony

201.courseDetails: Draping introduces the fundamental principles and techniques of fabric draping as a means of creatively interpreting and developing contemporary designs. The emphasis on proportion, balance, and shape as they relate to design aesthetics broadens students' understanding for actualizing and realizing three-dimensional design prototypes using muslin and soft fabrications. Basic patterning, collars, bodice, and skirt variations are all covered. Style variations broaden students' creative, critical thinking, and technical abilities
201.keywords: Fabric Manipulation 3D Form Sculpting Proportion & Balance Style Line Placement Design Harmony

202.courseDetails: This course provides students with a foundational understanding of Game Design principles and techniques, utilizing industry-standard software such as Blender. Through hands-on exercises and projects, students will gain proficiency in creating three-dimensional models, characters, and assets tailored for diverse applications including animation, gaming, and visual effects.
202.keywords: Game Design, Digital Game, Game Experience

203.courseDetails: The Apparel Grading module focuses on teaching students the principles and techniques of grading patterns to create multiple sizes of a garment. Students will learn about the importance of grading for achieving consistent fit across different body sizes and how to apply grading rules to increase or decrease the dimensions of a pattern. By the end of the module, students will have developed a comprehensive understanding of apparel grading and will be able to apply their knowledge to create graded patterns for a range of garment sizes. They will also gain valuable skills that are essential for a career in fashion design and production.
203.keywords: Apparel Grading Pattern Grading Size Variation Grading Rules Fashion Production

204.courseDetails: Draping introduces the fundamental principles and techniques of fabric draping as a means of creatively interpreting and developing contemporary designs. The emphasis on proportion, balance, and shape as they relate to design aesthetics broadens students' understanding for actualizing and realizing three-dimensional design prototypes using muslin and soft fabrications. Basic patterning, collars, bodice, and skirt variations are all covered. Style variations broaden students' creative, critical thinking, and technical abilities.
204.keywords: Draping Proportion Three-Dimensional Design Patterning Creative Interpretation

205.courseDetails: To enable the student to feel and sculpt the fabric into a 3-dimensional form. To inculcate the sense of proportion and placement of style lines and obtain harmony and balance between the fabric and design.
205.keywords: Draping Proportion Three-Dimensional Design Patterning Creative Interpretation
